p: Many studies identified in this review were published on a time-scale that was relevant to the Zika response. However, a large number of predictions were published well after the epidemic peaks, limiting their ability to inform the response. Nonetheless, those studies may well be used to inform other preparedness activities and contributed to the general knowledge of the biology, epidemiology and/or ecology of ZIKV. Further, results may have been informally shared with public health officials or other relevant decision makers prior to publication. Similar delays to publication have also been noted in an analysis of modeling efforts during the 2015 Ebola epidemic, which noted a median publication lag of around three months [ 103].
